DataElement.preferredName: Pathology Specimen Central Reviewer Submission Ind-2
DataElement.preferredDefinition: a yes/no question to ask if a sample of tissue collected for research was sent to the coordinating facility specializing in the nature and cause of disease to critically evaluate and report results.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: related to a sample of tissue, blood or urine collected for research and sent to one or more persons specializing in the nature and cause of disease to critically evaluate and report test results.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A specialty concerned with the nature and cause of disease as expressed by changes in cellular or tissue structure and function caused by the disease process. (MSH98):Specimen; a bit of tissue or blood or urine that is taken or used for research purposes.

Concepts.definition: The medical science, and specialty practice, concerned with all aspects of disease, but with special reference to the essential nature, causes, and development of abnormal conditions, as well as the structural and functional changes that result from the disease processes. Informally used to mean the result of such an examination.

A part of a thing, or of several things, taken to demonstrate or to determine the character of the whole, e.g. a substance, or portion of material obtained for use in testing, examination, or study; particularly, a preparation of tissue or bodily fluid taken for examination or diagnosis.

Property.preferredDefinition: A single person who critically evaluates and reports on laboratory test results, protocols , or other data.:Submission; a message submitted for the judgment of others.

Concepts.definition: A single person who critically evaluates and reports on laboratory test results, protocols, or other data.
Something submitted for the judgment or consideration of others.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: attributes of a patient's laboratory sample, including the source, condition, and fixative.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The preferred Value Domain to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.administrativeNotes: 2022.12.28 Alt VM added per ticket request CADSR0001837. aj

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Conceptual domain that includes value meanings to be used for Indicator Value Meanings such as Yes, No, Unknown, No Applicable

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A caDSR representation term that is used to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no

Concepts.definition: A response or indicator that can have a value of either yes or no.

RepresentationTerm.changeDescription: 10.3.20 TL changed WFS from RETIRED PHASED OUT to RETIRED ARCHIVED. Changed Workflow Status DBW 04-27-2016

ValueDomain.changeDescription: 8/29/17 tt added CSI per Round 5 finalization task. 3/12/17 jk added Standard reg status; ownership transfered from CTEP to NCI Standards with concurrence of CTEP/Brian Campbell. jk

ReferenceDocuments.description: Is the pathology report and either (1) tumor tissue (blocks or unstained slides) or (2) a photomicrograph of the ER IHC slides from at least one site of metastatic disease and/or from primary breast cancer available for central review and analysis, and if photomicrographs were submitted, were H&E, PR, and Ki67 IHC's submitted if performed?
